answers.Describe complex shot size:: This video, shot from a first-person perspective, shows a motorcyclist riding. At the bottom of the frame, part of the rider’s hands gripping the handlebars is visible, with many spectators surrounding the area. As the motorcycle moves forward, it gradually approaches two people—one holding a camera and the other a boom microphone. They appear increasingly larger in the frame until about half of their bodies are visible in the lower right corner.

answers.Describe complex shot size:: This video presents a wide shot of a waterscape from a first-person perspective, with a small portion of the jet ski visible at the bottom of the frame throughout, while most of the frame shows the scenery.

This video, shot from a first-person perspective, shows a motorcyclist riding up a ramp, turning left half a circle and then rushing down a slope, with many spectators surrounding the area. The motorcyclist's helmet and part of their body are visible at the bottom of the frame.

This video, captured with a head-mounted camera, shows a wingsuit flyer in mid-air. The camera faces backward, with only the subject’s arms and part of their back visible, and another person flying higher behind them is fully visible.

The head-mounted camera on the skier initially shows half of the skier's body. Then, as the skier leaps into mid-air, the camera switches to a full-body shot. When the skier lands on the ground, the camera shows only part of the skier's arm and mostly the snowy scenery.

answers.Describe complex shot size:: The video uses a camera mounted on the race car to capture a racing scene. Most of the car and part of the driver’s body are visible in the lower half of the frame. On the right side, two other race cars are initially present but eventually move out of the frame.
The camera begins with an extreme wide shot of a crowded area. A boat then enters the frame from the bottom right, and the camera begins to track it. Overall, the scene remains an extreme wide shot.

In this video, the camera is mounted on a gun. At the beginning, both the gun barrel and the upper body of a person are visible. Then, as the gun is raised and aimed forward, the person moves out of the frame, leaving only the hand holding the gun, the gun barrel, and a field landscape in view.

answers.Describe complex shot size:: The video begins with a full shot of a surfer with one knee on the surfboard. As the surfer gradually stands up, the camera continues to capture their entire figure. Due to the low angle of the camera and the surfer leaning backward, their lower half appears larger than the upper half.

The video shows a person gliding through the air face down, with the camera fixed below them. Only part of their head and upper body are visible at the top of the frame, while a vast mountain landscape is displayed below.

answers.Describe complex shot size:: The camera transitions from an inverted perspective to a top-down view, then to an eye-level view through a craning-down motion, moving around the car and the surrounding people. The main subject, a singer standing in front of a car surrounded by a group of men, initially appears as a distant headshot. As the camera cranes closer, the shot gradually expands into a full-body view of the singer.
